SENT.plain: Adenocarcinoma of the lower oesophagus is rapidly increasing in industrialised countries
The importance of Barrett's oesophagus is because of the potential for it to progress to oesophageal adenocarcinoma
It has a strong correlation to chronic GORD
Symptomatic patients or those with a long segment, if dysplasia is present or the patient is under 50 years of age, should be offered anti-reflux surgery
Patients may be denied the procedure by some gastroenterologists
